etymology.description: Depicts a trident-like weapon or tool 𢦐 -> borrowed for sound as 我 (wǒ, 'I').
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a weapon similar to a three-bladed polearm, it was phonetically borrowed to represent the pronoun 'I'. Its association with weaponry connects to the concept of self-defense, indirectly linking it to individual identity.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢阅读(我喜歡閱讀)。
我昨天去了市场(我昨天去了市場)，买了很多水果(買了很多水果)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān qùle shìchǎng, mǎile hěn duō shuǐguǒ.
examples.english: I went to the market yesterday and bought a lot of fruits.
